poem:
**The Levy**

In the morning light our thoughts  
coil around pixels and paint,  
and the hum of AI whispers  
through the seams of creation.  
Tax the glass obelisks,  
to save the flicker of our hands—  
the alchemy of pigment,  
the soul-caught breath,  
before the circuits  
steal it all away.
